018
019package org.jdrupes.vmoperator.manager.events;
020
021import java.lang.ref.WeakReference;
022import java.util.Collection;
023import java.util.Map;
024import java.util.Optional;
025import java.util.Set;
026import java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap;
027import java.util.function.Function;
028import org.jgrapes.core.Channel;
029
030/**
031 * A channel manager that maintains mappings from a key to a channel.
032 * As a convenience, it is possible to additionally associate arbitrary
033 * data with the entry (and thus with the channel).
034 * 
035 * There are several usage patterns for this class. It can be used
036 * by a component that defines channels for housekeeping. It can be
037 * shared between this component and another component, preferably
038 * using the {@link #fixed()} view for the second component.
039 * Alternatively, it can also be used to track the mapping using
040 * "add/remove" events and the channels on which they are delivered. 
041 *
042 * @param <K> the key type
043 * @param <C> the channel type
044 * @param <A> the type of the associated data
045 */
046public class ChannelManager<K, C extends Channel, A> {
047
048    private final Map<K, Data<C, A>> channels = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
049    private final Function<K, C> supplier;
050    private ChannelManager<K, C, A> readOnly;
051
052    /**
053     * Helper
054     */
055    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.ShortClassName")
056    private static class Data<C extends Channel, A> {
057        public WeakReference<C> channel;
058        public A associated;
059
060        /**
061         * Instantiates a new value.
062         *
063         * @param channel the channel
064         */
065        public Data(C channel) {
066            this.channel = new WeakReference<>(channel);
067        }
068
069    }
070
071    /**
072     * Combines the channel and the associated data.
073     *
074     * @param <C> the generic type
075     * @param <A> the generic type
076     */
077    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.ShortClassName")
078    public static class Both<C extends Channel, A> {
079
080        /** The channel. */
081        public C channel;
082
083        /** The associated. */
084        public A associated;
085
086        /**
087         * Instantiates a new both.
088         *
089         * @param channel the channel
090         * @param associated the associated
091         */
092        public Both(C channel, A associated) {
093            super();
094            this.channel = channel;
095            this.associated = associated;
096        }
097    }
098
099    /**
100     * Instantiates a new channel manager.
101     *
102     * @param supplier the supplier that creates new channels
103     */
104    public ChannelManager(Function<K, C> supplier) {
105        this.supplier = supplier;
106    }
107
108    /**
109     * Instantiates a new channel manager without a default supplier.
110     */
111    public ChannelManager() {
112        this(k -> null);
113    }
114
115    /**
116     * Returns the channel and associates data registered for the key
117     * or an empty optional if no mapping exists.
118     * 
119     * @param key the key
120     * @return the result
121     */
122    public Optional<Both<C, A>> both(K key) {
123        synchronized (channels) {
124            var value = channels.get(key);
125            if (value == null) {
126                return Optional.empty();
127            }
128            var channel = value.channel.get();
129            if (channel == null) {
130                // Cleanup old reference
131                channels.remove(key);
132                return Optional.empty();
133            }
134            return Optional.of(new Both<>(channel, value.associated));
135        }
136    }
137
138    /**
139     * Store the given data.
140     *
141     * @param key the key
142     * @param channel the channel
143     * @param associated the associated
144     * @return the channel manager
145     */
146    public ChannelManager<K, C, A> put(K key, C channel, A associated) {
147        Data<C, A> data = new Data<>(channel);
148        data.associated = associated;
149        channels.put(key, data);
150        return this;
151    }
152
153    /**
154     * Store the given data.
155     *
156     * @param key the key
157     * @param channel the channel
158     * @return the channel manager
159     */
160    public ChannelManager<K, C, A> put(K key, C channel) {
161        put(key, channel, null);
162        return this;
163    }
164
165    /**
166     * Returns the channel registered for the key or an empty optional
167     * if no mapping exists.
168     *
169     * @param key the key
170     * @return the optional
171     */
172    public Optional<C> channel(K key) {
173        return both(key).map(b -> b.channel);
174    }
175
176    /**
177     * Returns the {@link Channel} for the given name, creating it using 
178     * the supplier passed to the constructor if it doesn't exist yet.
179     *
180     * @param key the key
181     * @return the channel
182     */
183    public Optional<C> getChannel(K key) {
184        return getChannel(key, supplier);
185    }
186
187    /**
188     * Returns the {@link Channel} for the given name, creating it using
189     * the given supplier if it doesn't exist yet. 
190     *
191     * @param key the key
192     * @param supplier the supplier
193     * @return the channel
194     */
195    @SuppressWarnings({ "PMD.AssignmentInOperand",
196        "PMD.DataflowAnomalyAnalysis" })
197    public Optional<C> getChannel(K key, Function<K, C> supplier) {
198        synchronized (channels) {
199            return Optional
200                .of(Optional.ofNullable(channels.get(key))
201                    .map(v -> v.channel.get())
202                    .orElseGet(() -> {
203                        var channel = supplier.apply(key);
204                        channels.put(key, new Data<>(channel));
205                        return channel;
206                    }));
207        }
208    }
209
210    /**
211     * Associate the entry for the channel with the given data. The entry
212     * for the channel must already exist.
213     *
214     * @param key the key
215     * @param data the data
216     * @return the channel manager
217     */
218    public ChannelManager<K, C, A> associate(K key, A data) {
219        synchronized (channels) {
220            Optional.ofNullable(channels.get(key))
221                .ifPresent(v -> v.associated = data);
222        }
223        return this;
224    }
225
226    /**
227     * Return the data associated with the entry for the channel.
228     *
229     * @param key the key
230     * @return the data
231     */
232    public Optional<A> associated(K key) {
233        return both(key).map(b -> b.associated);
234    }
235
236    /**
237     * Returns all associated data.
238     *
239     * @return the collection
240     */
241    public Collection<A> associated() {
242        synchronized (channels) {
243            return channels.values().stream()
244                .filter(v -> v.channel.get() != null && v.associated != null)
245                .map(v -> v.associated).toList();
246        }
247    }
248
249    /**
250     * Removes the channel with the given name.
251     *
252     * @param name the name
253     */
254    public void remove(String name) {
255        synchronized (channels) {
256            channels.remove(name);
257        }
258    }
259
260    /**
261     * Returns all known keys.
262     *
263     * @return the sets the
264     */
265    public Set<K> keys() {
266        return channels.keySet();
267    }
268
269    /**
270     * Returns a read only view of this channel manager. The methods
271     * that usually create a new entry refrain from doing so. The
272     * methods that change the value of channel and {@link #remove(String)}
273     * do nothing. The associated data, however, can still be changed.
274     *
275     * @return the channel manager
276     */
277    public ChannelManager<K, C, A> fixed() {
278        if (readOnly == null) {
279            readOnly = new ChannelManager<>(supplier) {
280
281                @Override
282                public Optional<Both<C, A>> both(K key) {
283                    return ChannelManager.this.both(key);
284                }
285
286                @Override
287                public ChannelManager<K, C, A> put(K key, C channel,
288                        A associated) {
289                    return associate(key, associated);
290                }
291
292                @Override
293                public Optional<C> getChannel(K key) {
294                    return ChannelManager.this.channel(key);
295                }
296
297                @Override
298                public Optional<C> getChannel(K key, Function<K, C> supplier) {
299                    return ChannelManager.this.channel(key);
300                }
301
302                @Override
303                public ChannelManager<K, C, A> associate(K key, A data) {
304                    return ChannelManager.this.associate(key, data);
305                }
306
307                @Override
308                public Optional<A> associated(K key) {
309                    return ChannelManager.this.associated(key);
310                }
311
312                @Override
313                public Collection<A> associated() {
314                    return ChannelManager.this.associated();
315                }
316
317                @Override
318                public void remove(String name) {
319                    // Do nothing
320                }
321
322                @Override
323                public Set<K> keys() {
324                    return ChannelManager.this.keys();
325                }
326
327                @Override
328                public ChannelManager<K, C, A> fixed() {
329                    return ChannelManager.this.fixed();
330                }
331
332            };
333        }
334        return readOnly;
335    }
336}
